description: Complete coverage of all PCR rules and ethical obligations from notes 1, 2, and 3

rule_4.title: Rule 4 - General Principles
rule_4.key_concept: Paramount duty to court takes precedence over duty to client
requirements: Lawyer's paramount duty to Court takes precedence over duty to client
Duty to client is subject only to duty to Court
Must uphold standing and integrity of Singapore legal system
Must discharge responsibilities honorably and with integrity
Must uphold laws of Singapore in practice
Must facilitate public's access to justice
Must be fair and courteous to everyone
Must keep up to date with legal developments
case_law: Law Society of Singapore v Ahmad Khalis bin Abdul Ghani - Objective standard of professionalism
LSS v Rasif David - 3 essential attributes: disciplined body, learned art, public service
LSS v Tan Phuay Khiang - Spirit and intent of rules, not just letter

retainer_formation.title: B1 - Formation and Termination of Retainer

client_definition.contentious: S2(1)(a) LPA - Person who retains/employs solicitor OR liable to pay costs
client_definition.non_contentious: S2(1)(b) LPA - Person with power to retain/employ OR liable to pay costs

implied_retainers.test: Objective test - intention to enter solicitor-client relationship imputed to all parties
implied_retainers.case_law: LSS v Ahmad Khalis bin Abdul Ghani, LSS v Lee Suet Fern

retainer_formation.warrant_to_act: Lawyer must obtain WTA from client before representing

termination.withdrawal: By voluntary withdrawing or duty to withdraw
termination.rule_26: Completion of retainer and withdrawal from representation

rule_5.title: Rule 5 - Honesty, Competence and Diligence
general_principles: Be honest in dealings with client
Use all legal means to advance client's interests

specific_duties.5_2_a: Be honest in dealings with client
specific_duties.5_2_c: Act with diligence and competence in provision of services
specific_duties.5_2_d: Ensure relevant knowledge and skills required for client's matter
specific_duties.5_2_e: Keep client reasonably informed of progress
specific_duties.5_2_f: Promptly respond to client's communications where practicable
specific_duties.5_2_i: Follow client's instructions if lawful, proper and reasonable
specific_duties.5_2_j: Use all legal means to advance client's interests
specific_duties.5_2_k: Keep contemporaneous records of client's instructions and advice

rule_6.title: Rule 6 - Confidentiality
rule_6.continues_after_retainer: Duty continues even after retainer ends

five_exceptions.details: Express or implied consent from client

five_exceptions.exception: Disclosure required by law or court order
Prevent death or serious bodily harm
five_exceptions.details: Imminent threat to life or safety

five_exceptions.exception: Prevent client from committing crime or fraud

rule_20.title: Rule 20 - Interests of 2 or More Clients
rule_20.general_rule: Cannot act for clients with conflicting interests
rule_20.case_a_not_taken: Lawyer HAS NOT taken on matter - RIGHT FROM THE START
rule_20.case_b_already_taken: Lawyer HAS already taken on matter

informed_consent.requirement: Clients give informed consent after full disclosure
conditions: Full disclosure of nature and extent of conflict

specific_scenarios: Two clients in same transaction (buyer and seller)
Two clients in litigation against each other
Two clients with competing business interests
Husband and wife in divorce proceedings

rule_21.title: Rule 21 - Current Client vs Former Client
rule_21.general_rule: Cannot act for current client against former client if confidential information could be used
three_exceptions: Information is not relevant to current matter
rule_21.injunction_requirements: Former clients can apply to Court for injunction to restrain law firm
specific_scenarios: Former client's business partner now wants to sue them
Former client's competitor wants to hire you
Former client's creditor wants to enforce debt

rule_22.title: Rule 22 - Client vs Lawyer/Law Practice Interests
rule_22.case_a_lawyer: FOR LAWYER - Personal interests conflict with client interests
rule_22.case_b_law_practice: FOR LAW PRACTICE - Law practice interests conflict with client interests
conflict_types: Financial conflicts (you stand to gain/lose money)
Law practice interests (other clients, firm reputation)
specific_scenarios: Client wants to sue your business partner
Client wants to buy property you own
Client's case could affect your other client
You have personal relationship with opposing party

rule_15B.title: Rule 15B - Conflict of Interest in Family Proceedings
rule_15B.general_rule: Cannot act for one party in family law matters if previously acted for both parties
specific_scenarios: Husband and wife want joint representation in divorce
You previously acted for both parties in property transaction
One spouse wants to hire you after you acted for both
You have confidential information about both parties

rule_23.title: Rule 23 - Prohibited Borrowing Transactions
rule_23.exception: Client is financial institution in ordinary course of business
rule_23.consequences: Breach of Rule 23(1)(a), (b), or (c) leads to disciplinary action

rule_24.title: Rule 24 - Purchases from Client
exceptions: Client is in business of selling such property
Client gives informed consent after independent advice

rule_25.title: Rule 25 - Gifts from Client
rule_25.general_rule: Cannot accept significant gift from client
exceptions: Gift is reasonable and not significant
duties_when_gift_intended: Advise client to get independent legal advice

week_2_content.title: Week 2: Administration of Justice
week_2_content.source: Notes 2 - Practitioner's Role in Administration of Justice

rule_9.title: Rule 9 - Conduct of Proceedings before Court or Tribunal
principles: Duty to assist in administration of justice
Act honorably in interests of administration of justice
Uphold integrity of Court and contribute to attainment of justice
Be truthful and accurate in communications
Not present false evidence or information
Maintain fairness, integrity and efficiency of proceedings
Comply with all applicable laws and practice directions
rule_9.paramount_duty: Lawyer has paramount duty to Court

specific_duties.9_2_a: Do not mislead Court, Court staff, other lawyer, any witness
specific_duties.9_2_b: Do not fabricate any fact or evidence
specific_duties.9_2_c: Do not include false statements in court documents
specific_duties.9_2_d: Do not express personal opinion of client's conduct
specific_duties.9_2_e: Do not allow personal opinion to affect work
specific_duties.9_2_f: Do not mislead Court with wrong law
specific_duties.9_2_g: Do not concoct any evidence or fact
specific_duties.9_2_h: Do not draft court documents with prohibited statements
specific_duties.9_3_a: Inform Court of relevant decisions and laws
specific_duties.9_3_b: Disclose every fact and evidence required

case_law: Public Trustee v By Products Traders Pte Ltd - Paramount duty to Court
Prometheus Marine Pte Ltd v King, Ann Rita - Cannot follow client's untenable instructions
LSS v Ng Bock Hoh Dixon - Abuse of court documents

rule_10.title: Rule 10 - Responsibility for Client's Conduct

specific_duties.10_2: Inform client of client's duties to the Court
specific_duties.10_3: Prevent client from suppressing evidence and giving false evidence
specific_duties.10_4: If client gives false evidence, cease acting or continue but don't perpetuate falsehood
specific_duties.10_5: Don't render advice for dishonest, fraudulent or unlawful purposes

rule_10.when_can_disbelieve_client: When there are reasonable grounds to doubt client's truthfulness
rule_10.disclosure_obligations: Explain to client their disclosure obligations and supervise disclosure process
rule_10.duty_of_candour: Duty of candour owed to court - do not suppress evidence
rule_10.no_duty_to_police: Lawyer has no duty to inform police of criminal information about parties

rule_11.title: Rule 11 - Conflict of Interest in Proceedings
rule_11.principles: Cannot act if you have a conflict in court proceedings

specific_duties.11_2: Cannot appear before Court if in conflict of interest
specific_duties.11_3_a: Cannot act for client if you're required to give evidence material to the case

rule_11.lawyer_as_witness: Cannot be both lawyer and witness in same case
common_scenarios: You witnessed the incident your client is being sued for
You have personal knowledge of facts in dispute
You were involved in the transaction being litigated
You have financial interest in the outcome

rule_12.title: Rule 12 - Communications and Dealings with Witnesses

prohibitions.12_2: Cannot discuss with witness after cross-examination starts
prohibitions.12_3: Cannot make unaddressed allegations during cross-examination
prohibitions.12_4: Cannot suggest witness is guilty of offense
prohibitions.12_5: Cannot make statements to vilify, insult or annoy witness
prohibitions.12_8: Cannot offer payment contingent on evidence given

permitted.12_6: Can interview any witness (including opposing witness)

rule_12.witness_preparation: Lawyer's duties when preparing witnesses for trial

rule_13.title: Rule 13 - Respect for Court and Related Responsibilities
rule_13.principles: Show respect to court and honor all undertakings

specific_duties.13_3: Be courteous to Court and other persons
specific_duties.13_4: Honor all undertakings given to Court
specific_duties.13_5: Don't give undertaking unless necessary and you can honor it
specific_duties.13_6: Don't facilitate publication of contemptuous material

rule_13.conduct_end_hearing: Don't pack up until hearing is completely over
rule_13.forgery: Forgery of court documents is serious misconduct

rule_14.title: Rule 14 - Conducting Defence in Criminal Proceedings
rule_14.principles: Special duties when defending criminal cases

specific_duties.14_2: Pursue every reasonable defense for the accused
specific_duties.14_4: When accused confesses to offense - handle properly
specific_duties.14_8: When accused has previous convictions - handle properly

rule_14.case_law: Iskandar bin Rahmat v LSS - Duty to pursue all reasonable defenses

rule_15.title: Rule 15 - Conducting the Prosecution in Criminal Proceedings
rule_15.principles: Special duties when prosecuting criminal cases

specific_duties.15_2: Present evidence against accused fairly and without fear
specific_duties.15_3: Inform Defense Lawyer of certain things
specific_duties.15_4: Inform Court of certain information after conviction, before sentencing
specific_duties.15_5: Cannot inform Court of pending proceedings unless relevant
specific_duties.15_6: Assist Court by correcting any errors

rule_7.title: Rule 7 - Responsibilities to Each Other
rule_7.principles: Courtesy and fairness to other legal practitioners

specific_duties.7_2: Duty of courtesy and fairness to other legal practitioners
specific_duties.7_3: Cannot communicate with clients represented by other lawyers
specific_duties.7_4: Can give second opinion but must not improperly influence client
specific_duties.7_5: Ensure payment of appointed legal practitioner's fees
specific_duties.7_6: Honor undertaking given to another legal practitioner
specific_duties.7_7: Don't give undertaking unless necessary and you can honor it
specific_duties.7_8: Can ask for authorization to act for a person

rule_28.title: Rule 28 - Default Judgement
rule_28.duty: Observe 2-day notice requirement before entering default judgement

rule_29.title: Rule 29 - Allegations Against Another Legal Practitioner
rule_29.duty: Cannot make allegations against another lawyer in court documents unless certain circumstances

duties.30_1: Cannot communicate with Court about facts or issues unless certain circumstances
duties.30_2: If non-compliance, inform opposing counsel as soon as possible

rule_31.title: Rule 31 - Communication with Another Legal Practitioner
rule_31.duty: Cannot disclose to Court any communication with opposing counsel unless agreement

rule_8.title: Rule 8 - Conduct in Relation to Other Persons
rule_8.principles: Fair and proper conduct with non-lawyers

specific_duties.8_2: Duties when dealing with unrepresented layman
specific_duties.8_3: Cannot take unfair advantage or act deceitfully
specific_duties.8_4: Cannot issue letter of demand for anything not recoverable by law
specific_duties.8_5: Cannot threaten criminal or disciplinary proceedings
specific_duties.8_6: Cannot represent party in mediation if previously acted as mediator

rule_8.personal_conduct: Lawyer's personal conduct can form basis of disciplinary action
rule_8.public_institutions: Duty to cooperate with legal requirements of public institutions

rule_32.title: Rule 32 - Responsibility for Staff
rule_32.duty: Exercise proper supervision over staff working under lawyer in law practice
rule_32.purpose: Protect public and ensure legal advice only from qualified persons
case_law: LSS v Tan See Leh Jonathan - Proper supervision vital for public protection
LSS v Yeow Siew Chye Troy - Need system of periodic checks
LSS v Clarence Lun Yaodong - Practice trainee supervision requirements

s33_lpa.title: S33 LPA - Unauthorized Persons Carrying Out Lawyering
prohibited_acts: Offer or agree to provide lawyering services (s33(3))
s33_lpa.consequences: Additional consequences when money received by unauthorized person
s33_lpa.practical_tips: Solicitor should not rubber-stamp work by unauthorized person

s77_lpa.title: S77 LPA - Lawyers Assisting Unauthorized Persons
offenses: Assist unauthorized person in carrying out lawyering
Authorize unauthorized person to operate solicitor bank account

paralegal_supervision.title: Supervision of Paralegals
paralegal_supervision.definition: Legal executive/secretary/clerk who performs paralegal functions without practicing certificate
guidance: Paralegals are unauthorized persons under LPA
Lawyer must constantly supervise and be responsible for paralegal's actions
Ensure paralegals do not make unsupervised court appearances
Paralegals have no right of audience but can attend court under conditions

rule_33.title: Rule 33 - Descriptions and Titles
rule_33.duty: Proper use of professional titles and descriptions

rule_34.title: Rule 34 - Executive Appointments
rule_34.prohibited: Lawyers absolutely prohibited from certain executive appointments in non-law businesses
exceptions: Lawyer in LP may accept appointment in another LP if 2 conditions satisfied (Rule 34(2))
Lawyer may accept appointment in law-related services business (Rule 34(3))
Lawyer may accept appointment in institutions listed in Third Schedule (Rule 34(7))
rule_34.consequences: Breach is due cause for disciplinary action under s83 LPA

publicity.title: Publicity Rules
publicity.general_rule: Lawyers may publicize practice if comply with PCR
publicity.general_duties: PCR imposes general duties on lawyers who publicize
publicity.specific_duties: PCR imposes specific duties on lawyers who publicize
special_scenarios: Publicity restrictions when contributing to good causes
Publicity restrictions when giving free legal advice at legal clinic
Publicity restrictions when participating in 3rd party's publicity
Publicity restrictions when publicizing outside Singapore
publicity.public_appearances: Ethicality of publicity through public appearances and publications
publicity.third_party_websites: Ethicality of 3rd party websites having hyperlinks to lawyer/LP websites
publicity.letterheads: Ethicality of identifying lawyers/LPs on letterheads
publicity.online_referral: Ethicality of online referral and introduction schemes
publicity.email_guidelines: Ethical guidelines for using emails in legal practice
publicity.internet_publicity: Ethical guidelines for publicity through internet

touting.title: Touting Rules
touting.restrictions: Touting restrictions in correspondences to potential clients when acting for client

rule_39.title: Rule 39 - Referral Arrangements
rule_39.step_2: General duties when reason to believe client was referred
duties: Rule 39(2)(b) - Specific duties for referral arrangements
rule_39.consequences: Non-compliance leads to DT, then Court if referred

rule_40.title: Rule 40 - Conveyancing Referrals
rule_40.additional_requirements: Additional requirements for referral agreements for conveyancing service

case_law: Case Law Examples - Breach of Rule 39(2)(b)
Case Law Examples - Breach of Rule 39(2)(g)

rule_38.title: Rule 38 - Prohibited Business, Trade or Calling
rule_38.prohibition: Lawyers absolutely prohibited from engaging in certain businesses
rule_38.consequences: Breach is due cause for disciplinary action under s83 LPA

rule_16.title: Rule 16 - Client Money Duties
rule_16.duties: Duties owed to client in relation to client's money

lpsar.title: Legal Profession (Solicitors' Accounts) Rules
lpsar.client_money_definition: Identifying client's money and client's account

part_1.title: Receiving Client Money
part_1.duty: Put client money in client account immediately without delay (Rule 3(1))
part_1.special_scenario: Where lawyer receives mixture of client's money and other moneys
part_1.multiple_accounts: Lawyer can keep as many client accounts as fit (Rule 3(2))
part_1.lien_setoff: Solicitor's right of lien or set-off

part_2.title: Client Account Restrictions
part_2.duty: Cannot put any other money in client account (Rule 6)

part_3.title: Withdrawals from Client Account
part_3.duty: Can only withdraw money under Rule 7
part_3.council_approval: Council approval required for withdrawal outside Rule 7
part_3.overdrawn: Duty to ensure client's account is not overdrawn

part_4.title: Withdrawal Procedures
part_4.duty: Follow prescribed mode of withdrawal under Rule 7
restrictions: No withdrawal by cash cheque or bearer cheque for Rule 7(1)(c), 7(1)(d)
No withdrawal by cash cheque or bearer cheque unless GDHC authorization
No withdrawal by ATM or Telephone banking service
No withdrawal from account with approved finance company unless approved

part_5.title: Large Withdrawals
part_5.duty: Follow Rule 8 additional conditions for withdrawals above $5k
part_5.rules_5k_30k: Rules for withdrawals above $5k and less than $30k
part_5.no_transfers: Duty to not transfer sums between accounts

part_6.title: Accounting Records
part_6.bills_records: Keep accounting records of bills of costs
part_6.reconcile: Duty to reconcile books and statements
part_6.preserve: Duty to preserve books for at least 6 years from last entry
part_6.bookkeeper: Book-keeper to keep books and accounts
part_6.council_power: Council has power to require lawyer to produce books of accounts

lpsar.case_law: Case Law Examples - Failure to keep accounting records in breach of Rule 11 of LPSAR

aml_cft.title: Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Combating the Financing of Terrorism (CFT)
aml_cft.cdd_duty: Lawyer/LP duty to perform 3-part customer due diligence (CDD)
aml_cft.triggers: Whether lawyer/LP duty to perform CDD is triggered
aml_cft.tip_off: Whether CDD will tip-off suspicious client
aml_cft.part_2: Assess risk of money laundering and terrorism financing
aml_cft.part_3: Carry out enhanced CDD for higher risk clients
aml_cft.unable_to_complete: When lawyer/LP unable to complete CDD measures on client
aml_cft.duty_not_act: Duty to not act for client/Duty to consider filing suspicious transaction report
aml_cft.suspicious_client: When lawyer/LP suspect client of ML/FT
aml_cft.duty_act: Duty to act when client is suspect of ML/FT
continuing_duties: Continue performing CDD during course of business relationship
Maintain documents and records relating to relevant matters
Maintain documents and records obtained through CDD measures
Make documents and records available to Council when necessary

c1_duties_charging.title: C1 - Duties relating to charging of legal fees
duties: Rule 17(2)(a) - Not unnecessarily or improperly increase legal fees
Rule 17(2)(b) - Use best endeavors to complete work as soon as reasonably possible
Rule 17(7) - Not overcharge (even if fee agreement)
Rule 17(9) - Not overcharge when recommending alternate representation
permissible: Gross sum payment of legal costs is permissible if not unreasonable
No practice of Two-Thirds rule in Singapore
Equity in lieu of fees is prima facie permissible (subject to usual restrictions)

c2_duties_advising.title: C2 - Duties relating to advising client of basis of legal fees
duties: Rule 17(2)(c) - Explain any proposal of amicable resolution from opposing party
Rule 17(2)(d) - Provide translation of proposal if client doesn't understand English
Rule 17(2)(e) - Advise client on consequences of pursuing matter vis-Ã -vis expense
Rule 17(2)(f) - Advise client of relevant legal issues for informed decision
Rule 17(3) - Inform client about fees and other payments
Rule 17(4) - Inform client about responsibility for costs in contentious matter

c3_court_assessment.title: C3 - Duties in relation to Court assessment of bill (taxation proceedings)
duties: Rule 17(5) - Explain client's right to apply to Court to assess bill
Rule 17(6) - Explain that Court assessment might result in larger assessed bill
taxation: Unreasonable bill in taxation does not automatically constitute overcharging

rule_18.title: Rule 18 - Contingency Fees
rule_18.prohibition: Contingency fees prohibited - paid only upon successful suit
rule_18.duty: Cannot enter into negotiations for contingency fees
exceptions: Agreement to charge pro bono client SnC costs if successful - Permissible
Agreement to cap client's SnC costs based on quantum of PnP costs awarded - Permissible
prohibited: Contingency fees based on percentage of sum recovered from trial
Agreement to charge client SnC costs based on quantum of PnP costs recovered in default judgement
Agreement to charge client SnC costs based on quantum of PnP costs recovered

rule_19.title: Rule 19 - Sharing Fees with Unauthorized Persons
rule_19.duty: Cannot share legal fees with any unauthorized person for work done by lawyer
rule_19.debt_collectors: Use of debt collectors to recover legal fees - Prohibited

ethics_framework.title: The ETHICS Checklist
ethics_framework.description: Use this systematic approach for every ethics scenario

H.name: Honesty to Court
questions: Is lawyer supervising client conduct properly?

I.name: Improper Financial Arrangements
questions: Is lawyer accepting gifts from clients?

steps.name: Issue Statement
steps.description: State the issue clearly: 'Whether [lawyer] breached [Rule X] by [specific conduct]'

steps.name: Rule Application
steps.description: Quote the rule requirement and identify any exceptions

steps.name: Analysis
steps.description: Apply facts to rule, consider exceptions, conclude: breach/no breach

steps.name: Reasoning
steps.description: Explain why this conclusion and what proper conduct would be
